meanings.definition: To cast (an actor) in an unsuitable role.
meanings.sent1: The director miscasts the comedian as the serious detective.
meanings.sent2: She always miscasts her best friend in the villain roles.
meanings.sent3: It's like miscasting a clown as a king in a play!
meanings.sent4: Her decision to miscast the rookie as the team captain backfired.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's choice to miscast the shy student as the lead surprised everyone.

meanings.definition: To cast (a role) with an inappropriate actor.
meanings.sent1: He miscasts the young actress in the role of the wise grandmother.
meanings.sent2: The producer often miscasts the action hero in romantic comedies.
meanings.sent3: It's a bit funny when they miscast the dog as the lead actor in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The director's decision to miscast the singer as the scientist was puzzling.
meanings.sent5: The casting director's mistake to miscast the child as the CEO was quite memorable.
